original_title: Target’s CEO is stepping down as customers turn away | CNN Business
article_summary: Target CEO Brian Cornell steps down after 11 years, replaced by COO Michael Fiddelke in 2026, as the retailer faces slumping sales and backlash over its retreat on DEI initiatives. The company's stock performance has been poor, and analysts question whether the internal appointment will address the company's deep-rooted issues.</s>
